text:
Mon diner était bon en général. Bonne soupe wong-tong salé, pas besoin d'ajouter de sauce soja. Poulet sauce arachides: bonne sauce, bon poulet mais la texture un peu spongieuse...ma collègue n'a pas aimée. Les légumes faisaient un peu légumes congelés, mais la sauce était bonne, salé.

L'ambiance est correct, entre moderne et asiatique. La musique par contre nous a tous un peu endormi, style classique/orchestre sans parole. Il y avait aussi une photo bizare d'un groupe de personnes en costume de bain en arrière de la caisse qui semblaient être en vacance...Disons que ce n'est pas l'endroit idéal pour ce genre de photo encadré lol.

Service excellent, rapide. Parfait pour l'heure du lunch au travail.

J'y retournerais pour goûter aux autres plats offerts!!

Excellent restaurant à fréquenter souvent!!! Pour la fine cuisine asiatique wow et la propreté des lieux!!! Vraiment nous avons tous adoré ce restaurant! Les quantités abondantes pour le souper, la fraîcheur et les prix!!!

We reserved for 14 people and they were very accommodating.  The table d'hote special is 2 people for $35 and each additional 16$. This is a crazy deal. Everybody ordered something different and I tasted almost every dish.  Hot and sour soup was good and so was the won-ton. Appetizer I tried the fried won-ton, crispy spinach, and spring rolls and all were good. The peanut butter dumplings were good but I found the dumplings very doughy.  The curry was very good, tender chicken and nice vegetables. Asked for extra spicy and it was perfect. When you order table d'hote they give free rice and an extra plate of steamed vegetables.  The general Tao is some of the best I've had in a long time. Crispy exterior and not full of fat or dough. There was a lot of sauce but it didn't soak the chicken but I'd order light sauce. A great alternative to the general Tao is the sesame chicken. Nice smaller pieces of chicken with a crispy exterior covered in sesame seeds. This is what I would order next time. The black pepper chicken was also delicious. I didn't like the Kung Pao, I found it lacked flavour. The lemon chicken is breaded like SooGuy style with a few slices of lemon.  The shrimp dish was covered in a red sweet sauce and is a definite avoid. For dessert you have the choice of a fortune cookie or fresh fruit slices included in the price or deep fried fruit which I did not try. 
The best part it's bring your own wine!
This restaurant exceeded all my expectations. The price was more than reasonable for a byow and the food was delicious.  I'll be coming back.
